full_text: @AreYou_Caden_Me I think they might be at the ploughing.
Thank you @irishcongress for your support for this bill and for your long time interest and engagement in the climate issue. #JustTransition #NoJobsOnADeadPlanet https://t.co/lPmxdgwzAT

I'm afraid @FineGael is addicted to the status quo. @RichardbrutonTD says our #JustTransition bill goes way beyond what they've envisaged & it'd be far better to let the existing system manage things the same old way. They've no climate ambition. No future vision. #ClimateStrike https://t.co/2E8hylQ3TZ

Introducing our Just Transition Bill in the Dail now. Establishing a specialist Commission to help communities manage the change to a low carbon economy, in a way that protects jobs and secures all our future. Many thanks to @sineadmercier who made it happen. #JustTransition https://t.co/9b87QKKt1p

.@climatecaseire judgement recognises unenumerated environmental constitutional rights but says courts are reluctant to interfere in national climate policy, due to the seperation of powers. It's up to the political system now to act on climate science. #ClimateStrike @FIEIRELAND https://t.co/bXOG5am9Ce

At the Four Courts waiting to hear the judgement on the argument from  @climatecaseire that the Government's National Mitigation Plan fails to promote climate action in line with the best scienctific advice. #climateaction #ireland https://t.co/ur2h1GTEvX

Glad to visit the @GreensUcd stand at @ucddublin freshers week yesterday. Not to put too much pressure on my alma mater but the @younggreens have just become the biggest political party in @tcddublin @UCC @nuigalway. #SignOfTheTimes #GreenWave  @TCD_Greens @UCCGreens https://t.co/CnnJCAgWpT

We've been in the neighbourhood of Victorian Cork over the weekend. Thinking about where our country goes from here. Planning how we can create a new economy that builds community. @greenparty_ie #metropole #cork @rtesixone @cobhanimation https://t.co/hg09mbdyAl https://t.co/cP94ZJlfoR

We stand up for young people. Not just protecting their future by tackling climate change but also making sure the system change that we need to meet that huge challenge, also gives them the freedom to find their own home in an affordable and fair way. https://t.co/tNSYCcGagh

We've a base of councillors now right across the country, who have the job of helping build a just transition in their own local communities. Everyone and everyplace matters. There is a better way. #GreenWave https://t.co/aYc2bt2W4q
@swtorh1ll Rest assurred we will be running in every constituency.
About to go on @morningireland as part of their series of party leaders interviews. Listen live here: https://t.co/GGp5rh0bXm
The current model promoting short rotation and clear felling of forests has to go. We can do forestry in a better way.  https://t.co/iWpIuONtmZ

Similar to a debate I had with Paul Murphy of @solidarityie in Tallaght last month. Can capitalism solve the climate crisis?  You can watch it here: https://t.co/Vr0wEdSKhx https://t.co/rqBbHYpka9

I am asking @LeoVaradkar to use his powers under standing order 26 to initiate an early return of the Dail. We need to debate what is happening with Brexit and have full transparency in our response to the evolving crisis in Westminster. https://t.co/bTtzkoYIYz

Good news. https://t.co/aGkwgY9Ww2 are due to help install ten swift boxes in the colonnades on either side of newly refurbished Leinster House. This remarkable bird is threatened by a lack of nesting sites. Hopefully we will see them next spring, flying out over Leinster Lawn. https://t.co/KoksNMLpCP

Protest now outside the Brazilian embassy against #AmazonFires. @LeoVaradkar should pull the #Mercosur trade deal now, not in two or three years time. #ExtinctionRebellion #FridaysForFurture  #ActForTheAmazon https://t.co/akDkvAmxvh

Our Government and the EU should be sending an ultimatum to the Brazilian Government, that they must stop destroying the Amazon rainforest or else forfeit any chance of a Mercosur Trade Deal.  #AmazonFire #Mercosur https://t.co/HNObzW5aBI

@kevinhorourke The EU have stood with Ireland because protecting the single market is fundamental to the Union. They can see the hard brexiters want to lower regulatory standards to gain competitive advantage. This will be a problem in agreeing a trade deal, not just the withdrawal agreement.

For over 30 years the Irish Seal Sanctuary @IrishSealS have been appealling to our better nature, to protect the greater good. Watch Brendan Price putting it up to the next generation here: https://t.co/MBzlfYA4FA  #StepItUpWorld https://t.co/KJRC47nYPc

Proud to help open an art exhibition by Marie Coyne this evening. She mixes delph found around the island with photgraphs of the old houses it came from. Recording the island community on #inishbofin. #WildAtlanticWay https://t.co/C5bELohQGN https://t.co/BcpVxuIElx

@AnnaDrJox @RMetrolink @Shane_RossTD @LeoVaradkar @MurphyEoghan @OCallaghanJim Not true. I am campaigning to have it run further south, either via UCD to Sandyford or via Terenure to Rathfarnham so we can spread the public transport gain. We also consistently supported a quiet way for cyclists through the area, which would have stopped the local rat run.

At an @ExtinctRebelsIE event in Galway today. Calling on the political system to tell the truth about the climate & biodiversity crisis. Turn the country zero carbon by 2035 and involve citizens in a #JustTransition. https://t.co/diqd1AlnJx

At a @galwaygreens stakeholders meeting. Very nervous saying this as a Dub but @GalwayCityCo seem hell bent on making Galway the least sustainable city in Western Europe. Developer-led planning. More roads, more sprawl. Polluted waters. Not enough parks. #cityofculture? #galway https://t.co/cQKL8VYCmD
About to go live here in Glenties in a #MaGill19 on the issue of climate change.  https://t.co/lG1mS80dnO https://t.co/H0nRcBrxMl

This should involve everyone. Everyplace matters and the time to act is now. #ClimateStrike #20thSeptember https://t.co/d8yPdJhm7J

I was glad to set out some of my own thinking about the future of Irish farming and wildlife on this podcast https://t.co/LVhN5A90Tc I recorded with David Whelan from Westport. #intothewest #organic https://t.co/bWWbVn8Uhc

There are all sorts of complex trade offs between different economic, social, climate & biodiversity objectives. It makes the case for a proper national land use plan. One that shows what type of farming, forestry & nature protection we want in each different part of the country. https://t.co/xebZVR4Gf5

We held a stakeholders meeting in @AirfieldEstate yesterday, bringing together environmental organisations, farmers & scientists to consider action 110 of the Government's climate action plan.  It proposes a new consultation on how 'land use mapping' might help us cut emissions. https://t.co/FM7MuQphks
Bridge building! https://t.co/tOS6GosDPU

Glad to join a @DodderAction clean up with @DonnybrookTidyT yesterday. Real concerns that over engineering by @opwireland in their flood prevention works may lead to more harm than good being done along the river. #River #greenway https://t.co/lB62Gws6Pp
Looking forward to this debate tonight. https://t.co/A37qfVh7oL

"The scale and speed of change we need to make is so great that we have to make sure that at least the next five governments in a row are bought into taking real climate action.    Stop-start policies will not work."   https://t.co/hZcAA3eDaG

Under our @greenparty_ie constitution members decide on key policy positions at our annual convention. We've being voting through the day on a variety of motions. Proud to be part of such a decent and democratic organisation. #green19 #LeadingTheChange https://t.co/vVlKesQrN8

The Government's transport plans mean more cars on roads, longer commuting times, polluted air and under-investment in public transport, cycling and walking infrastructure. Today I asked him to put the brakes on and make the changes we need. Full exchange: https://t.co/JuZZ3WwBZw https://t.co/btKeKBt3fE

At London Climate Action Week, thinking about how we fight the info ops coming from fossil fuel interests. @tom_burke_47 "It's not that people believe their lies but if told often enough, no one knows what to believe." @e3g #LCAW2019 #LCFF https://t.co/Sv5V2SEIHN

@CJayFla I want that high speed broadband to every home. Just asking the necessary questions as to we are going about it the right way. Who should own the asset? Can we deliver it with less of the expensive ducting sollutions being proposed?

.@BirdWatchIE report on Irish wildbird crisis. Lapwing 67% decline in last 20 years. Swift down 50% Mallard 40% 11/12 wading bird species in serious decline. Barn Owls, Curlews on red list. Sea birds in trouble with climate change. #ExtinctionRebellion     https://t.co/LE6HV3uAfv
@Ejmad I had to ditch them. Hard to dance in   Burkinstocks.
I called for same day testing in Dublin Bay today following the 15 sewage leaks over the last year. https://t.co/wHbeWSqpi6

Experts from the European Cyclist Federation are presenting to our Oireachtas Climate Committee on how cycling can reduce climate emissions. You can watch live now via committee room 3 here: https://t.co/PQkMyIAwVS #VC19 #Cyclingfortheages #dublin

.@NatureNymph of @BirdWatchIE 'It's time for us to invest in biodiversity as if our lives depend on it, because they do.'  2/3 of wild bird species threatened. 1/3 of wild bees facing extinction. 90% of Environment Protected Areas are degraded. #Budget20 https://t.co/4UpQckTo5c

The National Economic Dialogue is livestreamed now here: https://t.co/OmgLGsLoXN I'll be arguing for investing in a #GreenNewDeal as a stimulus to counter any economic downturn that may come from a no deal #Brexit. https://t.co/Hb8bWe4OrI

At Oirechtas Communications committee @eir state they'd provide broadband fiber to every house in the National Broadband area for €2 billion less than the current plan. Imagine the rural public transport services we could build from such a saving. @LeoVaradkar needs to respond. https://t.co/WSoebJEnlD

International delegates at @DublinVelo2019 are clearly shocked at cycling conditions in our city. They ask how can our political system tolerate such poor transport design, which discourages all but the very brave to cycle. #VC19 #Cyclingfortheages #Dublin https://t.co/lSBSZGL6EM

Velo-city 2019 is in Dublin this week. It's the biggest & best international conference on how we can make cycling cities. Lord knows we need that knowledge. I'd the usual horrors  cycling on Beaver Road, Anglesea Road & Macken Street to get here. #vc19 #CyclingForTheAges #Dublin https://t.co/MshAavqQ1d

At an @IEA conference on energy efficiency.  China all talk of green development, USA promoting innovation not regulation, green minister @ClaudeTurmes says short term capitalism will drive this world into a climate wall. We need long term loans to insulate & ventalate our homes. https://t.co/8dT0kKH9fU

.@Mabeytweet One reason our process worked well was because we followed up the citizens assembly with an all party committee accessing it's recommendations. There is a huge social, economic and health costs from the current system.  It will also be impossible for us to meet our long term climate goal unless the Department of Transport starts changing their ways. We have to stop the sprawl. #ClimateEmergency #dttas #Ireland2040 2/2 https://t.co/uGt43vauvG

For 25 years we've said that walking, cycling & public transport must come first but time & again it was decided to promote a roads based transport system instead. I set out some of that history in the Transport Committee today to explain the weakness in the #ClimatePlan2019. 1/2 https://t.co/q0eCfuggda

We need a new land use plan to go with #ClimatePlan2019.   Showing where & how we can plant more natural forests.   Devising a new future for Irish horticulture.   Growing dense hedgerows & agroforestry.   Rewilding large parts of our country.  Restoring prestine water quality. https://t.co/dxjvqHqmbg

The transport section of the @FineGael climate plan is all about technological tweaks rather than system change. It will do nothing to tackle the gridlock, social costs & waste their car dominated transport plans will bring. #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/E9HLrE4Eqm
I welcome the #ClimateActionPlan but wish it did 3 more things: 1 Commit now to net 0 by 2050. 2 Admit current NDP must change. 3 Agree new national land use plan. https://t.co/LAD3NeDwrV
@MrPtrickyD @sineadmercier @IRLDeptFinance @ESRIDublin Working on it.

.@ExtinctRebelsIE protest against @FineGael blocking any dail debate on the climate emergency bill. It would stop any new oil & gas exploration licences in Irish waters. Climate science says we need to keep 80% of known fossil fuel reserves in the ground. #ExtinctionRebellion https://t.co/WON1eDi52J

Well done everyone who turned up in Dublin this evening, to protest against the policies of the @realDonaldTrump administration. What he is doing risks all our future. His world view runs counter to everything we stand for. #TrumpInIreland #protest @greenparty_ie #UnitedNations https://t.co/o1uktYgTxJ

Congratulations @GraceOSllvn, the newly elected MEP for #IrelandSouth. She journeyed for years as an eco-warrior and it is time to pack her bags again, as she heads to Brussels & Strasbourg on our behalf. I'm sure she will do us proud. #GreenWave @europeangreens @greenparty_ie https://t.co/iA9GqdZQrI

Join the protest against Donald Trump this Thursday, 6th June, 6pm Garden of Remembrance, Parnell Square, Dublin 1. Come along if you think he is a danger to our world. https://t.co/9jtInzKNgN #climate #peace #refugees #collaboration https://t.co/v6U3yp8l1d
@derhamaine Just something that was given to me on holidays in Inishbofin, which i keep wearing because it reminds me of those good times.

.@davidmcw sets out the bigger picture, which explains the success of the recent #GreenWave: "It is a selfless form of politics, where we take a minute to think about the impact our individual decisions will have on the greater good."   https://t.co/Hw3pKZ1QBc

My statement to Dail Éireann on the #BiodiversityCrisis. Having lost half of all wildlife in the last 50 years, we need a new understanding of how connected we are to the natural world. Only by changing our ways can we have hope for the future. #Anthropocene #ExtinctionRebelion https://t.co/Pm5A2kGD2m

We need to leave 80% of already discovered fossil fuel reserves in the ground. Granting more exploration licences in the deep Atlantic makes no sense. We should develop our offshore wind resources instead. #KeepItInTheGround #fossilfree https://t.co/QeolmCu28g

A Dail majority wants to end new oil & gas exploration in Irish waters but @FineGael is stopping us turning that wish into law. There'll be another protest against this on June 11th next 1pm Kildare St. Be there if you agree with: #KeepItInTheGround #FossilFree #ClimateEmergency https://t.co/NesIWMo3Sc

There's a protest outside Dail at 1pm today against a Government decision to block the #climateemergency bill, which would put an end to oil and gas exploration in Irish waters. I'm about to ask @RichardbrutonTD his reasons for doing so. Watch live here:  https://t.co/3iwcmIjNXY https://t.co/TWhTHpF3lx

.@RichardbrutonTD should do some maths: We must keep 4/5ths of known fossil fuel reserves in the ground to avoid a 2°C+ rise. Why then did @FineGael just issue a licence to China Offshore Oil Corp/Exxon Mobile, to drill speculatively off the Kerry coast? https://t.co/PTALZAdlCv https://t.co/idYM12uiMi

At the Ireland South count #EP2019 @GraceOSllvn has 75,000 votes in the first count. We are quietly confident she may win a seat. It would be a massive achievement by her and a great boost for our @europeangreens. #GreenWave @greenparty_ie https://t.co/gifyLCnuTw

So pleased for my long time friend and colleague, on being first elected in Dublin. He will make a great member of the European Parliament. #GreenWave @europeangreens @greenparty_ie https://t.co/x5tdzJLYKH

So proud of @saoirse_mchugh who has polled 51,000 first preference votes in the Midlands-North-West. #EP2019 She ran a brilliant campaign and deserves real credit for helping create a Green wave of thinking, right across the country in recent weeks. https://t.co/KxPpTDKB7d

About to go on @RTERadio1 to discuss their exit poll. Our @europeangreens colleagues will be on tenderhooks, wishing we can return three MEPs. We hope to hold the balance of power in the new parliament. Every seat counts. #EP2019 #LE19 #greenwave https://t.co/fUKcHQnaSJ
@a_thaiscidh @saoirse_mchugh Not counting any chickens yet, but i have my dancing shoes shined and am ready to go.

I like living in a Republic, where every citizen has the same rights and freedoms under our laws. It's up to the people to decide who their leaders will be. Central to that Republican code is the right to vote.  Please make sure you exercise that power today. Please vote Green #1 https://t.co/AdjLd9zoDq

Out canvassing in Howth with @davidhealyv and who did we meet but my Aunt Margaret. Unlike any other election in the past, we have a sense across the country that there is a grey vote going green. #le19 #EP2019 #GreenWave #WantGreenVoteGreen https://t.co/kEvc87edmp

At the @ECOUNESCO Young Environmentalist Awards. 1500 students here to present ideas for how we can better look after nature and ourselves. There has been a sea change in public opinion, thanks to the voice and actions of this next generation  #YEA19 https://t.co/bMtY68FeVN
